laboratory_examinations.findings: Computed tomographic scans revealed severe craniosynostosis, with evidence of high intracranial pressure. All sutures were closed. The optic foramina were normal, but the optic nerve sheaths were dilated, indicating papilledema.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Computed tomographic scans for both boys demonstrated thumbprinting, maxillary hypoplasia, fused sutures, and small ventricles.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Sixty percent of patients with progressive craniosynostosis exhibited papilledema preoperatively, compared with 25 percent of classic craniosynostosis patients.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Regular follow-up examinations demonstrated good vision and no evidence of papilledema.
